authors: Ahmed, K. · Islam, N. · Sen, R. · Roy, D.
title: Bāko Corpus 2.0: A 5-Billion Token Web Corpus for Bengali
body: After two years of crawling, cleaning, and de-duplicating, we are releasing BākoCorpus 2.0 — the largest open Bengali text corpus ever published. This paper describes our pipeline for quality filtering and deduplication.

title: Morphological Inflection in Agglutinative Languages: Lessons from Bengali
body: This study provides a formal computational account of Bengali's rich morphological system—agglutinative verb forms, honorific scales, and nominal declension.

authors: Chakraborty, M. · Tamang, S. · Islam, F.
title: Low-Resource Neural Machine Translation: Bengali↔Tibetan
body: How we constructed a 52,000-sentence parallel corpus for one of the world's most challenging language pairs — and what it reveals about the limits of transfer learning from large multilingual models.

authors: Rahman, M. · Hossain, T. · Chowdhury, S. · Islam, N. · Sen, R. · Ahmed, K. · Das, P.
title: BengaliQA: A Large-Scale Open-Domain Question Answering Benchmark
body: We introduce BengaliQA, a 50,000-question benchmark for open-domain QA in Bengali, covering 12 domains. We evaluate 8 multilingual models and find significant performance gaps compared to English benchmarks, motivating Bengali-native LLMs.

title: Tonal Variation in Chittagonian: A Computational Phonological Analysis
body: Chittagonian Bengali exhibits tonal distinctions absent from Standard Bengali. We present the first large-scale acoustic corpus study of 1,200 minimal pairs and develop a computational model of tonal phonology using autosegmental representation.
